description: GenAI Gateway overview: throughput, success, latency, streaming, tokens, cost, backend health, gateway internals, ingestion limits, and traces. Uses $__rate_interval for smoothing and window-wide calculations where appropriate. End‑user explanations under each widget.

panels.description: **Maximum requests per second observed in the selected time range.** Highlights bursty load that the average may smooth over.
panels.title: Max Req/s (range)

panels.description: **Maximum successful (2xx) requests per second in the selected window.** Pairs with the success rate metric below.
panels.title: Max 2xx Req/s (range)

panels.description: **Worst p95 latency observed in the selected window.** Shows peak tail latency that the lower card averages across the range.
panels.title: Max P95 Latency (s)

panels.description: **Highest share of streaming responses observed in the selected window.** Surfaces peak streaming utilisation before averaging below.

targets.expr: max_over_time(((sum(increase(apisix_http_status_total{request_type="ai_stream",route=~"$route",backend_identifier=~"$backend_identifier",llm_model=~"$llm_model"}[$__range])) or vector(0)) / clamp_min((sum(increase(apisix_http_status_total{route=~"$route",backend_identifier=~"$backend_identifier",llm_model=~"$llm_model"}[$__range])) or vector(0)), 1))[$__range:]) or vector(0)

panels.title: Max Streaming Requests % (range)

panels.description: **Highest concurrent LLM connections observed in-range.** Highlights surges that can drive throttling.
panels.title: Peak LLM Connections (range)

panels.description: **Average requests per second over the selected time range.** Useful to see typical load even if the last few minutes are quiet.
panels.title: Avg Req/s (range)

panels.description: **Share of successful responses (2xx).** If this dips into yellow or red, check the **Errors** and **Backend Health** sections.
panels.title: Success %

panels.description: **How long users wait (95th percentile).** Rising values mean slower responses for many users, not just outliers.
panels.title: P95 Latency (s)

panels.description: **Share of requests that used streaming across the selected range.** Higher shares often feel faster and smoother to users.
panels.title: Streaming % (range)

panels.description: **Live concurrency.** Spikes here can be a precursor to slower responses or throttling.
panels.title: Active LLM Connections

panels.description: **Top routes by live traffic.** If only one route exists, you’ll see just that one here.
panels.title: Req/s by Route (TopN)

panels.description: **Breakdown of successes and errors.** 4xx usually means client issues; 429/5xx points to throttling or upstream problems.
panels.title: Requests by Status Code

panels.description: **Latency over time.** p50 shows typical users; p95/p99 show the slowest ones. If only p95/p99 rise, the tail is getting worse.
panels.title: Gateway Latency Percentiles by Route (p50/p95/p99)

panels.description: **LLM backend delay.** If this rises while gateway latency is stable, upstream providers may be slowing down or throttling.
panels.title: LLM Round‑trip P95 by Backend

panels.description: **Burn rate (5m & 1h).** > 1 means your error budget would be exhausted if the current rate continued.
panels.title: SLO Burn (5m) vs 1% budget

panels.description: **Burn rate (5m & 1h).** > 1 means your error budget would be exhausted if the current rate continued.
panels.title: SLO Burn (1h) vs 1% budget

panels.description: **Input tokens by model.** High numbers here drive cost; consider prompt optimization or caching.
panels.title: Prompt Tokens/min by Model (TopN)

panels.description: **Output tokens by model.** If this outpaces input tokens, responses may be too verbose.
panels.title: Completion Tokens/min by Model (TopN)

panels.description: **Cost now and total cost in the selected window.** Spikes may come from particular models (see right chart).
panels.title: Cost $/min (current)

panels.description: **Accumulated cost within the selected window.** Provides context for the per-minute rate below.
panels.title: Total Cost (range)

panels.description: **Which models cost the most per minute right now.** Use this to prioritize optimization or routing changes.
panels.title: Cost $/min by model (TopN)

panels.description: **Reliability per backend (Top‑N).** With only one active backend this will match the overall Success %.
panels.title: Backend Success % (Top N)

panels.description: **What’s failing upstream.** The color stacks show which error types dominate per backend.
panels.title: Backend Errors by Status

panels.description: **Aggregate shared dict usage across all caches.** Useful to see remaining headroom overall.
panels.title: Shared Dict Usage % (overall)

panels.description: **Gateway’s own socket load.** A growing backlog here often leads to slower responses.
panels.title: Nginx Connection States

panels.description: **Health of the telemetry pipeline.** If these drop or spike, charts above may be misleading.
panels.title: Exporter & Scrape Health

panels.description: **Shared dict utilization per cache (Top 10).** Highlights the hottest dictionaries to resize or prune.

targets.expr: topk(10, (sum by (name) (apisix_shared_dict_capacity_bytes) - sum by (name) (apisix_shared_dict_free_space_bytes)) / clamp_min(sum by (name) (apisix_shared_dict_capacity_bytes), 1))

panels.title: APISIX Shared Dict Usage % (Top 10, sorted)

panels.description: **How close you are to the series quota.** If this nears red, reduce label cardinality or raise limits.
panels.title: Active Time Series % Utilization

panels.description: **Current series vs allowed maximum.** Running close to the limit causes data drops.
panels.title: Active Time Series vs Limit

panels.description: **Share of your per‑minute ingestion limit used.** High values predict throttling.
panels.title: Events/min % Utilization

panels.description: **Your current ingestion vs the ceiling.** If the blue line touches the limit, expect dropped data.
panels.title: Events/min vs Limit

panels.description: **Any drops are a red flag.** The reason tells you whether it’s rate limits, too many series, or something else.
panels.title: Dropped Samples/Events by Reason

panels.description: **Traced call volume by operation.** Confirms that traces match gateway traffic.
panels.title: Traces Calls/s by Span (TopN)

panels.description: **How long traced operations take (95th percentile).** Use this to pinpoint slow services.
panels.title: Traces P95 Duration (s) by Span

list.label: Azure Managed Prometheus
list.name: amp_ds
list.description: Primary Azure Managed Prometheus data source UID used for all Prometheus queries.

list.label: Azure Monitor
list.name: azmon_ds
list.description: Azure Monitor data source UID used for Azure-native metrics queries.

list.label: Subscription
list.name: subscription
list.description: Azure subscription hosting the resource to query.

list.label: Resource group
list.name: resource_group
list.description: Resource group containing the Azure Monitor resource.

list.label: Resource namespace
list.name: resource_namespace
list.description: Resource provider namespace and type (for example Microsoft.App/containerApps).

list.label: Resource name
list.name: resource_name
list.description: Specific resource to query within the selected namespace.

list.label: Route
list.name: route
list.description: Regex filter for the APISIX route label; defaults to all routes when set to ".*".

list.label: Backend
list.name: backend_identifier
list.description: Regex filter for APISIX backend identifiers so you can isolate specific upstreams.

list.label: LLM Model
list.name: llm_model
list.description: Regex filter for llm_model label across all metrics.

list.label: Top N series
list.name: topN
list.description: Controls how many series the Top N panels return (routes, models, etc.).

title: Dashboard-10-29-2025-10-36
